meanings.sent1: Using old technology can outmode your devices quickly.
meanings.sent2: Technology advances so fast that it can outmode products within a year.
meanings.sent3: The new smartphone outmoded the old flip phone in no time.
meanings.sent4: The digital age has outmoded many traditional ways of doing things.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring innovation can easily outmode your business in today's market.

meanings.definition: To go out of fashion or become unfashionable.
meanings.sent1: Wearing bell-bottoms may outmode you in a modern fashion world.
meanings.sent2: Trends in clothing can quickly outmode certain styles.
meanings.sent3: Her bold fashion choices sometimes unintentionally outmode her friends.
meanings.sent4: The classic black dress never seems to outmode, unlike other trends.
meanings.sent5: Trying to keep up with every trend can be exhausting and may still outmode you.
